name: Miller Tree Inn Bed & Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I chose this place based on the Trip Advisor reviews. We had the large suite with a fireplace. The suite was very spacious! Perfect for the four of us. The house was cute with fun decorations. The owners were very nice and accommodating. The breakfast was very good as well. The price was a little high, but I was grateful they allowed children.
reviews.title: Fun place to stay while visiting Forks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Months before arriving, we had reserved the Weathervane Room in this period piece house in central Forks. Ringing the bell at promptly 4:30 PM, we were greeted enthusiastically by Rachel, who efficiently showed us around the guest areas of the house and ultimately up the two storeys to our room—the only one on the top floor, and actually providing two bedrooms. A dish offering our favourite--York mint patties--was a very welcome treat and the little fridge was stocked with cans of assorted soft drinks and juices. Atop the fridge were glasses, a corkscrew and, in a protective bag, a cutting board with sharp knife for preparing fruit, cheese, or other snacks. A digital clock sat on one bedside table. Rather than taking up room on the little tables (perfect size for the spaces), reading lamps were positioned on the wall to each side of the bed headboard. The pillow-top mattress and two-each full-sized pillows provided deep, refreshing sleeps. Each of Weathervane's rooms has a TV on the wall for reliving a Twilight saga on DVD or watching the news of the real world. The squeaky-clean bathroom was attactively but not fussily appointed and well-stocked. Particularly helpful was having a mirror in the bedroom as well as in the bathroom. (For a future stay, we would also consider trying the spacious Cedar Room at the front of the house on the second floor.) Once out of bed, one of us would sneak in dressing gown down to the dining room to bring back mugs of coffee from the carafe on the sideboard. Breakfasts, prepared by Cheryl, were delicious, not over-the-top, and just the fuel we needed to embark on our all-day explorations; seconds were available along with bottomless coffee. Many hours later, we returned to gratefully boost our energy from the assortment of cookies, fruit and snacks as well as much-needed coffee set out for guests (along with many teas and hot water). The lounge on the main floor sports two enveloping recliners and a TV. A nearby bookshelf displays two rows of video movies. Miller Tree Inn is on the less-traffic end of Division Street, but within easy walks to most of the restaurants and shops in town. For Twilight fans, this eye-catching house has apparently been designated as the Cullen family home. Although some of the other guests were on pilgrimages, as were drive-up fans content with exterior shots of themselves against the backdrop of the picturesque house, we did not feel out of place. In fact, Miller Tree Inn was the perfect base to begin our several-day exploration of the beaches to the west—the focus our vacation. Although we would have liked to meet the owners, Susan and Bill, they were out of town; nevertheless, Cheryl and Rachel were excellent representatives.
reviews.title: A Must-Stay B&B in Forks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: First trip to Washington could not have been better and that is due to the decision to stay at the Miller Tree Inn. This is a place that feels like home from the minute you turn into the drive. Bill and Susan make you feel right at home when they open the door and welcome you into their home…or should I say the Cullen home! Being a Twilight fan it could not have been more perfect but even if you have never read a Twilight book or have never seen a Twilight movie or if you are one of the 6 people in the world that don’t know what I mean by “Twilight” this place is still for you. The entire home is comfortable and warm and the food, well the food is incredible and delicious and good and yummy. You never leave the breakfast table hungry that is certain. And Bill and Susan are fine host and trip advisors. Every place they suggested was just as they said it would be and well worth going to see, find, experience and be a part of. I can not say enough about the time I spent at this lovely bed and breakfast but one thing I know for sure it that I will be back. Please don’t miss out on a stay at the Miller Tree Inn. You will be treated well and you won’t want to leave.
reviews.title: Best decision of the trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in the Elk View Room for three nights. We had a pleasant experience. We enjoyed the breakfasts, and the view from our sitting room. Didn't meet the owners in person, but talked with them on the phone. They were very pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Miller Tree Inn for a few nights, as my husband was fishing in the area. The hosts were very friendly and helpful and the home-made breakfast really made my mornings. Nice living room area to hang out and have a cup of coffee.
reviews.title: Friendly and cozy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Forks has been, for as long as I've visited, a depressed area, and will likely continue to be; however, Miller Tree provides a break from that. It brings the comforts of home to someone who is on vacation. This is very much appreciated. Since I knew I wanted to spend some more time in Forks (to see the ONP), I decided to book Ella's suite for my friend and me for four nights.
reviews.title: Makes Forks a nicer place to stay

reviews.text: The fridge was of good quality. My friend and I bought a decent amount of food, and we had more than enough shelf space to store it. The complimentary sodas were extra nice.
reviews.title: Nice, Friendly, needs a little TLC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The sitting area in the room is a nice place to relax. Since I spent more time sitting here than I did last time, I think it would have been nice to have had access to an ottoman. I should have asked, but maybe this can be placed in the room in the future?
reviews.title: Twilight Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed for one night at the Miller Tree Inn B&B in Forks. The hosts were great, breakfast was excellent and it was a perfect choice for getting to the rainforest early. When I explore the coast and Olympic National Park in the future they'll be my first place to call for a reservation.
reviews.title: A great escape close to the Hoh Rainforest in the Olympics

reviews.title: Comfortable, Cozy and a Taste of the Best Forks Has To Offer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: The Miller Tree B & B (aka Cullen House) is bar none the best place to stay in Forks, whether you are a Twilight fan or a fisherman. The service and food are top notch and the location is fabulous. The house is impeccably kept and is decked out with some wonderful touches that make you feel at home.
reviews.title: Wonderful hosts!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: Of course we came for Twilight but left with much more than memories of chasing vampires & werewolves! Bill & Susan are the most amazing people. They go out of their way to make you feel welcome and have created such a fun place to stay that is not only comfortable but inviting as well! Our room was excellent, spacious & clean with every detail taken care of! We enjoyed hanging out in the common areas with the other guests, chatting, taking pictures & making sure Pocket Edward had his share of the fun! We cannot wait until our daughters are old enough to chase the fairy tale...so we can bring them to 'The Cullen House'!
reviews.title: Part Reality Part Fairy Tale!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had the pleasure of spending two nights at Miller Tree in early November, 2012. Our room was most comfortable, the owners were relaxed and friendly, and the breakfasts were delicious. Each evening there were goodies set out to nibble on and drinks readily available. The house is especially interesting if you are a Twilight fan. Set on the outskirts of the small community of Forks, the grounds are lovely. We also found the folks in Forks to be very welcoming. We have stayed in approximately 25 B & B's and Miller Tree was one of the best.
reviews.title: Superb B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My first B&B experience. The hosts are nice, made us feel at home. Rooms are very cozy and comfortable and well equipped. Location is very nice too, looking out over a barn. Conveniently located from Hurricane ridge, rialto beach, neah bay, etc. Delicious breakfast.
reviews.title: Awesome, relaxing & satisfying experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a wonderful surprise on our first foray into the Olympic Peninsula area.
reviews.title: Delightful experience in an otherwise dreary town

description: Three-story 1916 farm house, located on the edge of town. 8 guest rooms each have a private bath, TV/DVD player and free WiFi access. 3 of these rooms have a whirlpool tub and gas fireplace. A full, hot, sit-down breakfast is included in the room rates. The inn serves as a base to explore the west side of Olympic National Park, including the Hoh Rain Forest (45 minutes away) and the Pacific Ocean at LaPush and Rialto Beach (20 minutes away). Recently, it has become a stand-in for the Cullen House, on tours exploring sites mentioned in Stephenie Meyers' "Twilight" book saga. However, our inn looks nothing like the Hollywood version, which is located in Portland, OR.
